clusters.title: Trump's envoy to have Ukraine peace plan talks at Kremlin
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Envoy to Meet Putin Regarding Ukraine Peace Plan

items.title: Trump's envoy to have Ukraine peace plan talks at Kremlin
items.standfirst: Russia confirms the US president's close aide will travel to Russia, hours after Trump tasked him with meeting Putin.
items.content: Russia confirms the US president's close aide will travel to Russia, hours after Trump tasked him with meeting Putin.

items.title: Trump envoy Witkoff reportedly advised Kremlin official on Ukraine peace deal
items.standfirst: Steve Witkoff spoke to Yuri Ushakov on territorial control and suggested congratulating Donald Trump and framing talks more optimistically, audio recording suggestsDonald Trump’s special envoy Steve Witkoff told a senior Kremlin official last month that achieving peace in Ukraine would require Russia gaining control of Donetsk and potentially a separate territorial exchange, according to a recording of their conversation obtained by Bloomberg.In the 14 October phone call with Yuri Ushakov, the top foreign policy aide to the Russian president, Vladimir Putin, Witkoff said he believed the land concessions were necessary all while advising Ushakov to congratulate Trump and frame discussions more optimistically. Continue reading...
items.content: Steve Witkoff spoke to Yuri Ushakov on territorial control and suggested congratulating Donald Trump and framing talks more optimistically, audio recording suggestsDonald Trump’s special envoy Steve Witkoff told a senior Kremlin official last month that achieving peace in Ukraine would require Russia gaining control of Donetsk and potentially a separate territorial exchange, according to a recording of their conversation obtained by Bloomberg.In the 14 October phone call with Yuri Ushakov, the top foreign policy aide to the Russian president, Vladimir Putin, Witkoff said he believed the land concessions were necessary all while advising Ushakov to congratulate Trump and frame discussions more optimistically. Continue reading...

items.title: Live: Kremlin confirms US envoy Witkoff to visit as Trump eases peace plan deadline
items.standfirst: The Kremlin has confirmed next week's visit by US envoy Steve Witkoff to meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin. President Donald Trump has also said he would send Army Secretary Dan Driscoll to meet with Ukrainian officials as he seeks to close out a deal to end the war in Ukraine. Trump said his proposed peace plan had been “fine-tuned”, backed away from setting a firm deadline, and said his son-in-law Jared Kushner may join Witkoff in Moscow. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.
items.content: The Kremlin has confirmed next week's visit by US envoy Steve Witkoff to meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin. President Donald Trump has also said he would send Army Secretary Dan Driscoll to meet with Ukrainian officials as he seeks to close out a deal to end the war in Ukraine. Trump said his proposed peace plan had been “fine-tuned”, backed away from setting a firm deadline, and said his son-in-law Jared Kushner may join Witkoff in Moscow. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.

items.title: Trump says he's sending his envoys to see Putin and Ukrainians after fine-tuning plan to end war
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump says his plan to end the war in Ukraine has been "fine-tuned."
items.content: President Donald Trump says his plan to end the war in Ukraine has been "fine-tuned."

items.title: US envoy Witkoff advised Russia on getting Trump to Ukraine deal, Bloomberg reports
items.standfirst: US envoy Steve Witkoff advised the Kremlin on how Russian President Vladimir Putin should best pitch a revised peace deal on Ukraine to President Donald Trump in mid-October, Bloomberg reported Tuesday evening.
items.content: US envoy Steve Witkoff advised the Kremlin on how Russian President Vladimir Putin should best pitch a revised peace deal on Ukraine to President Donald Trump in mid-October, Bloomberg reported Tuesday evening.

items.title: Trump Reacts to Report That Steve Witkoff Advised Russia on Ukraine Deal

items.content: The president downplayed a report that his special envoy advised Russian officials on a peace plan.

items.content: President’s comments come as Moscow signals it could reject proposal that differs from Alaska talks

items.title: US to send envoy to Moscow to discuss proposals to end Ukraine war
items.standfirst: Despite recent efforts and White House optimism, recent negotiations have failed to secure a breakthrough on key issuesDonald Trump said he would send special envoy Steve Witkoff to meet Vladimir Putin in Moscow to discuss developing proposals to end the Ukraine war, but despite White House optimism there was little sign of progress on core sticking points.The US president said negotiations had left “only a few remaining points of disagreement” but there was no breakthrough on the issues of territorial control and security guarantees and he dampened expectations of immediate peace summits. Continue reading...
items.content: Despite recent efforts and White House optimism, recent negotiations have failed to secure a breakthrough on key issuesDonald Trump said he would send special envoy Steve Witkoff to meet Vladimir Putin in Moscow to discuss developing proposals to end the Ukraine war, but despite White House optimism there was little sign of progress on core sticking points.The US president said negotiations had left “only a few remaining points of disagreement” but there was no breakthrough on the issues of territorial control and security guarantees and he dampened expectations of immediate peace summits. Continue reading...

items.content: US president sends Steve Witkoff to meet Vladimir Putin to iron out 'a few' differences over plan to end Ukraine war.

items.title: Brazil's former President Jair Bolsonaro begins 27-year prison sentence for coup attempt
items.standfirst: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro on Tuesday started his 27-year prison sentence for leading a coup attempt, to the surprise of many in the South American nation who doubted he would ever end up behind bars. Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes, who has overseen the case, ruled Bolsonaro will remain in custody after being preemptively arrested on Saturday. FRANCE 24's Jan Onoszko reports from Rio de Janeiro.
items.content: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro on Tuesday started his 27-year prison sentence for leading a coup attempt, to the surprise of many in the South American nation who doubted he would ever end up behind bars. Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes, who has overseen the case, ruled Bolsonaro will remain in custody after being preemptively arrested on Saturday. FRANCE 24's Jan Onoszko reports from Rio de Janeiro.

items.title: Bolsonaro ordered to start serving 27-year prison sentence for Brazil coup plot

items.content: The ex-president was sentenced to more than 27 years in prison for trying to foment a coup after his election loss.

items.title: Jair Bolsonaro ordered to start 27-year prison term for plotting Brazil coup
items.standfirst: Ex-president to start serving term in 12 sq metre bedroom in police base in Brasília after time for appeals elapsesBrazil’s former president, Jair Bolsonaro, has been ordered to start serving his 27-year sentence in a 12 sq metre bedroom in a police base in the capital, Brasília, after his conviction for plotting a coup.The far-right populist, 70, who governed Latin America’s largest democracy from 2019 until 2022, was handed the punishment in September after the supreme court found him guilty of leading a criminal conspiracy to stop his leftwing rival, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, taking power. Continue reading...

items.title: Brazil's ex-president Bolsonaro exhausts appeals, will serve 27-year sentence
items.standfirst: Brazil's Supreme Court on Tuesday concluded former President Jair Bolsonaro's coup plotting case after rejecting his appeal earlier this month. The court is expected to order Bolsonaro to serve a 27-year prison sentence.
items.content: Brazil's Supreme Court on Tuesday concluded former President Jair Bolsonaro's coup plotting case after rejecting his appeal earlier this month. The court is expected to order Bolsonaro to serve a 27-year prison sentence.

clusters.title: Italy now recognizes the crime of femicide and punishes it with life in prison
clusters.neutral_headline: Italy Makes Femicide a Crime Punishable by Life

items.title: Italy now recognizes the crime of femicide and punishes it with life in prison
items.standfirst: Italy's parliament on Tuesday approved a law that punishes femicide with life in prison. The vote coincided with the international day for the elimination of violence against women.
items.content: Italy's parliament on Tuesday approved a law that punishes femicide with life in prison. The vote coincided with the international day for the elimination of violence against women.(Image credit: Roberto Monaldo)

items.title: Italy votes to makes femicide a crime
items.standfirst: Italian lawmakers on Tuesday unanimously backed a bill making femicide – the intentional killing of women or girls – a specific crime punishable by life imprisonment. The new article in the penal code creates a category of homicide “based on the characteristics of the victim”, according to the…
items.content: Italian lawmakers on Tuesday unanimously backed a bill making femicide – the intentional killing of women or girls – a specific crime punishable by life imprisonment. The new article in the penal code creates a category of homicide “based on the characteristics of the victim”, according to the…

items.content: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni has supported a bill to punish 'femicide' with life imprisonment.

items.title: Italian parliament unanimously votes to make femicide a crime

items.content: The gender-motivated murder of a woman will now be covered by a distinct clause in Italian law - punishable by a life sentence.

items.title: Violence against women: Debunking misogynistic masculinist propaganda
items.standfirst: To mark the International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women, Vedika Bahl talks through the rise in misogynistic propaganda online, and dismantles some of the popular masculinist arguments against women.
items.content: To mark the International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women, Vedika Bahl talks through the rise in misogynistic propaganda online, and dismantles some of the popular masculinist arguments against women.

items.title: International Day for the Elimination of Violence Against Women: How is AI reinventing misogyny?
items.standfirst: Every 10 minutes last year, a woman somewhere in the world was killed by a person close to her, while some 50,000 women and girls were killed by intimate partners or family members in 2024. These figures have been released by the UN as we mark the International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women and Girls. But how do we get the message across that violence against women and girls is a men's issue; particularly as the rise of AI has intensified digital abuse directed at women?
items.content: Every 10 minutes last year, a woman somewhere in the world was killed by a person close to her, while some 50,000 women and girls were killed by intimate partners or family members in 2024. These figures have been released by the UN as we mark the International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women and Girls. But how do we get the message across that violence against women and girls is a men's issue; particularly as the rise of AI has intensified digital abuse directed at women?

items.title: The rise of masculinism: Nine misogynistic propaganda arguments debunked (3/3)
items.standfirst: For the International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women, FRANCE 24 examines a sharp rise in masculinist discourse that seeks to normalise and legitimise misogyny. In this third and final part of the series, we look at some of the main arguments pushed by masculinist propaganda – and the facts and figures that debunk them.
items.content: For the International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women, FRANCE 24 examines a sharp rise in masculinist discourse that seeks to normalise and legitimise misogyny. In this third and final part of the series, we look at some of the main arguments pushed by masculinist propaganda – and the facts and figures that debunk them.

items.title: International Day for the Elimination of Violence Against Women
items.standfirst: In 2024 in France, 107 women were killed by their partner ot ex-partner.
items.content: In 2024 in France, 107 women were killed by their partner ot ex-partner.

items.title: How turkeys pardoned by Trump were chosen

items.content: Travis Pittman of Wayne County, North Carolina, had the honor of raising Gobble and Waddle -- the two turkeys selected to be pardoned by President Trump. Ed O'Keefe reports.

items.title: The origins of the presidential turkey pardon
items.standfirst: President Trump pardoned two turkeys named Gobble and Waddle on Tuesday. With that in mind, CBS News' Lindsey Reiser serves up the origins of the pardon event, one of Washington's quirkiest traditions.
items.content: President Trump pardoned two turkeys named Gobble and Waddle on Tuesday. With that in mind, CBS News' Lindsey Reiser serves up the origins of the pardon event, one of Washington's quirkiest traditions.

items.title: ‘Gobble and Waddle’: Trump pardons Thanksgiving turkeys, blasts Democrats
items.standfirst: Trump pardoned Thanksgiving turkeys Gobble and Waddle, saying he nearly named them Nancy Pelosi and Chuck Schumer.
items.content: Trump pardoned Thanksgiving turkeys Gobble and Waddle, saying he nearly named them Nancy Pelosi and Chuck Schumer.

items.title: Trump turns turkey pardon into political attack on Democrats and Biden
items.standfirst: A light-hearted White House tradition turned sharply partisan on Tuesday, as President Donald Trump used the annual turkey-pardoning ceremony to attack Democrats, revive conspiracy claims about Joe Biden and deliver a string of questionable economic boasts.
items.content: A light-hearted White House tradition turned sharply partisan on Tuesday, as President Donald Trump used the annual turkey-pardoning ceremony to attack Democrats, revive conspiracy claims about Joe Biden and deliver a string of questionable economic boasts.

items.title: U.S. officials meet with Russian delegation after Ukrainians amend drafted peace deal
items.standfirst: U.S. officials are meeting with a Russian delegation in Abu Dhabi after meeting with a Ukrainian delegation, who reviewed a peace deal drafted by the Trump administration. NBC News' Daniele Hamamdjian reports on the next steps towards peace and the airstrike that Russia carried out on Kyiv during the talks.

clusters.title: Daughter of ex-South African leader Zuma accused of luring men to fight in Russia-Ukraine war
clusters.neutral_headline: Jacob Zuma’s daughter accused of tricking men into fighting for Russia in Ukraine

items.title: Daughter of ex-South African leader Zuma accused of luring men to fight in Russia-Ukraine war
items.standfirst: South African police are investigating claims that a daughter of ex-president Jacob Zuma was involved in recruiting men to join Russian mercenaries in the Ukraine war. The allegations against Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla claim Zuma-Sambudla and two other people were involved in recruiting 17 South Africans whom the presidency said this month it had been asked to rescue from Ukraine's war-ravaged Donbas region. FRANCE 24's Eunice Masson reports from Cape Town.
items.content: South African police are investigating claims that a daughter of ex-president Jacob Zuma was involved in recruiting men to join Russian mercenaries in the Ukraine war. The allegations against Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla claim Zuma-Sambudla and two other people were involved in recruiting 17 South Africans whom the presidency said this month it had been asked to rescue from Ukraine's war-ravaged Donbas region. FRANCE 24's Eunice Masson reports from Cape Town.

items.title: Jacob Zuma’s daughter accused of tricking men into fighting for Russia in Ukraine
items.standfirst: South African police investigate allegations made against Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla by another of ex-president’s daughtersEurope live – latest updatesSouth African police are investigating allegations that a daughter of the former president Jacob Zuma tricked men into fighting for Russia in Ukraine by telling them they were travelling to Russia for a paramilitary training course.Another of Zuma’s daughters, Nkosazana Zuma-Mncube, filed a police report on Saturday alleging that her sister Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla and two others, Siphokazi Xuma and Blessing Khoza, had recruited 17 men who are now trapped on the frontlines of the war in Ukraine. Continue reading...
items.content: South African police investigate allegations made against Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla by another of ex-president’s daughtersEurope live – latest updatesSouth African police are investigating allegations that a daughter of the former president Jacob Zuma tricked men into fighting for Russia in Ukraine by telling them they were travelling to Russia for a paramilitary training course.Another of Zuma’s daughters, Nkosazana Zuma-Mncube, filed a police report on Saturday alleging that her sister Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla and two others, Siphokazi Xuma and Blessing Khoza, had recruited 17 men who are now trapped on the frontlines of the war in Ukraine. Continue reading...

Another daughter filed a police report about the matter.

clusters.title: Flights cancelled as Ethiopian volcano erupts for first time in recorded history
clusters.neutral_headline: Flights cancelled as Ethiopian volcano erupts for first time in recorded history

items.title: Flights cancelled as Ethiopian volcano erupts for first time in recorded history
items.standfirst: Flights have been cancelled over ash clouds from Hayli Gubbi, a long-dormant volcano in Ethiopia, erupted for the first time in recorded history.
items.content: Flights have been cancelled over ash clouds from Hayli Gubbi, a long-dormant volcano in Ethiopia, erupted for the first time in recorded history.

items.title: Ethiopian volcano erupts for first time in 12,000 years
items.standfirst: Ash clouds from Hayli Gubbi volcano sent drifting across the Red Sea toward Yemen and OmanA volcano in Ethiopia’s north-eastern region has erupted for the first time in nearly 12,000 years, sending thick plumes of smoke up to 9 miles (14km) into the sky, and across the Red Sea toward Yemen and Oman.The Hayli Gubbi volcano, located in Ethiopia’s Afar region about 500 miles north-east of Addis Ababa near the Eritrean border, erupted on Sunday for several hours. Continue reading...
items.content: Ash clouds from Hayli Gubbi volcano sent drifting across the Red Sea toward Yemen and OmanA volcano in Ethiopia’s north-eastern region has erupted for the first time in nearly 12,000 years, sending thick plumes of smoke up to 9 miles (14km) into the sky, and across the Red Sea toward Yemen and Oman.The Hayli Gubbi volcano, located in Ethiopia’s Afar region about 500 miles north-east of Addis Ababa near the Eritrean border, erupted on Sunday for several hours. Continue reading...

ai_summary: An Ethiopian volcano erupted for the first time in history.
The volcano is called Hayli Gubbi.
Ash clouds caused flight cancellations.
The ash clouds drifted towards Yemen and Oman.
The eruption occurred in the Afar region.

items.title: Gaza aid operation blamed for string of deadly shootings to close down

items.title: US and Israel-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation to end operations in territory
items.standfirst: Four main food distribution sites operated by the opaque company had been flashpoints of deadly violence A controversial and secretive private company backed by the US and Israel that distributed food in Gaza has announced the end of its operations in the devastated territory.The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation (GHF), which had four food distribution sites that became flashpoints of chaos and deadly violence between May and October, said in a statement that it would shut down permanently, having “successfully completed its emergency mission”. Continue reading...
